title: stutter with dual monitor setup
body:
hello i am using benq xl2411z and another crappy 60hz monitor and when i play league of legends with both of them connected i get serious stutter it almost makes the game unplayable.
Using gtx 970 with amd fx 8350 8gb ram

ps:this happens only on league of legends

replies.body: From your post, it seems as though you don't experience this if you disconnect the 60Hz display, is this correct? If it is, can you confirm the Resolution and Refresh rates you're running in Windows for your BenQ XL display? Also, can you let me know what resolution and framerate cap you're running in League? Thanks!

yes when i disconnect my 60hz monitor its fixed i have 1920x1080 at 120hz on benq and 1280x1024 60hz on the other lg monitor at league i am not capping fps have vsync disabled and the graphics at high i think
Interesting. Can you try using Full-screen mode with vsync enabled and FPS capped at 120fps? I believe this may cause a change in the issue you're seeing and I'd be interested to hear of the results.
as i commented below i found the issue.It seems weird to me but i'l take it

Display management software can often cause issues for FPS, especially if the system is running displays at different refresh rates or resolutions. I'm glad to see you found the culprit and managed to find a workaround. :)
Make sure to check your DirectX for updates, sometimes running a n old version cause performance problems

i am running windows 7 and in order to have a task bar on my second monitor i need to use a program called actual multiple monitors.as soon as i exited from it i think the stutter was fixed so i removed it and i tried the task bar that came with the benq software(display pilot) and when i turned it on it stuttered again i dont get why the task bar makes such a difference.
I run 2 Dell monitors @ 60Hz with a GTX 970 and it works fine for me
